text: I made 28 return on my money in less than two months on this trade but I could have made more I want to walk you through the Apple ratio call diagonal I brought up on some of the YouTube live sessions and I want to share with you at the end of the video some different scenarios that could have played out if I placed the trade differently and talk about how I think about those because it's really important to keep things in context what's up everybody Eric here welcome back to all the outliers shout out to the patreon family if my videos are useful to you consider signing up helps me out a bunch let's get right into the video okay so here we have a trade in apple and essentially I entered here with some 190 days to expiration deep in the money long calls and I also sold some short premium against them the reason why I like this trade is because it allows me to benefit from The Leverage of options but then also collect some premium up front so that's exactly what I'm doing it's also known as a poor man's covered call which is slightly different than what I'm doing here so ratio diagonal now as I progress through the try trade I started noticing that there is definitely some bullish bias here I was getting the movements that I wanted to see and I needed to make some interesting adjustments

text: so I'm giving up anywhere from you you know six to ten points on my return here but this is predicated on me knowing the future that it's going to go up I didn't that's why I trade these and then if we look at buying the commensurate size in shares it would have been a 13 return on invested Capital that's another thing people ask all the time is is it better to just buy the shares it can be sometimes but in this case it's a little more nuanced because if I had bought again using ten thousand dollar account as the sample if I had bought ten thousand dollars worth of Apple when it was trading at 172 I would have had like 55 shares something like that 57 I think and if that made its run from 172 up to 196 that's my return 13.1 but what you're seeing here is leverage in this scenario I would have controlled again like 57 shares in this case I was controlling 200 shares on the same exact cost structure this is why sometimes if you use options for leverage it can actually be a pretty beautiful thing so if you have any questions on what I did why I managed it the way I did let me know throw down in the comments if you make the same trade and if so what would you make the trade in and until next time be an outlier I'll see
